casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Roberto M. FERRO, Defendant-Appellant. No. 08-10719

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. Sept. 8, 2008. Ryan Thomas Truskoski, Orlando, FL, for Defendant-Appellant. Judy K. Hunt, United States Attorney’s Office, Tampa, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellee.

Before BLACK, BARKETT and PRYOR, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

Ryan Thomas Truskoski, appointed counsel for Roberto M. Ferro, has moved to withdraw from further representation of the appellant and filed a brief pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Kilgore’s conviction and sentence are AFFIRMED.
